docs.snippet: REPRESENTATIVES of many Latin-American nations persistently claim that the United  States "ignores" their countries, instead devoting its attention to Europe. This is offered as justification for antiAmerican measures now making headlines in...
docs.lead_paragraph: REPRESENTATIVES of many Latin-American nations persistently claim that the United States "ignores" their countries, instead devoting its attention to Europe. This is offered as justification for antiAmerican measures now making headlines in Argentina, Brazil and Peru.
docs.abstract: A A Berle article on US relations with Latin Amer; revs situation since '47; holds US pub still for more interested in Eur affairs than in Latin-Amer; urges apptmt of Under Sec of State with top authority in Latin-Amer field and greater exch of information; illus

headline.main: Are We 'Ignoring' Latin America?; Perhaps not to the degree our critics below the border suggest, but our concern with their problems is still inadequate to the needs of both their future and our own. Are We 'Ignoring' Latin America?
